final_answer.precision_note: All input values (moles and volume) are given to three significant figures, so the result for Kc is reported to three significant figures.

method: First, the concentrations of the species at equilibrium are calculated using c = n / V. $[NO_2] = 0.180 	ext{ mol} / 2.00 	ext{ dm}^3 = 0.0900 	ext{ mol dm}^{-3}$. $[N_2O_4] = 0.220 	ext{ mol} / 2.00 	ext{ dm}^3 = 0.110 	ext{ mol dm}^{-3}$. Next, the concentrations are substituted into the equilibrium constant expression, $K_c = [NO_2]^2 / [N_2O_4]$. $K_c = (0.0900)^2 / 0.110 = 0.00810 / 0.110 \approx 0.0736$. The instruction specifies to report $K_c$ as dimensionless.
